org.forgerock.openam.radius.common.packet

Class CHAPPasswordAttribute

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.forgerock.openam.radius.common.Attribute
      • org.forgerock.openam.radius.common.packet.CHAPPasswordAttribute

  • public class CHAPPasswordAttribute
extends Attribute
    Class representing the structure of the CHAP-Password attribute as specified in section 5.3 of RFC 2865 and able to be instantiated from the on-the-wire bytes. This attribute is only included in access-requests.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class org.forgerock.openam.radius.common.Attribute

        MAX_ATTRIBUTE_LENGTH, MAX_ATTRIBUTE_VALUE_LENGTH

    • Constructor Summary

      CHAPPasswordAttribute(String password, int identifier)
      Construct a new instance from the password string and chap identifier code from the CHAP response.

    • Constructor Detail

      • CHAPPasswordAttribute

        public CHAPPasswordAttribute(String password,
                             int identifier)
        Construct a new instance from the password string and chap identifier code from the CHAP response. RFC 2865 isn't very clear on the "password" value other than saying it is 16 octets in length. For clarity we must read RFC 1994 section 4.1 that indicates the CHAP-Password hold a 16 byte hash value created as noted in the RFC. Therefore, we ensure that the resulting bytes are 16 in length and if less we pad them with 0 values. Additionally, the integer value should be less than 256 since it gets truncated to a single octet.
        Parameters:
        password - the CHAP response from the user
        identifier - the CHAP identifier

      • CHAPPasswordAttribute

        public CHAPPasswordAttribute(byte[] octets)
        Constructs a new instance from the on-the-wire bytes for this attribute including the prefixing attribute-type code octet and length octet.
        Parameters:
        octets - the on-the-wire bytes from which to construct this instance
